GRAYSCALE EXPANDS CRYPTO ETF FRONTIER 

Grayscale has registered Delaware trusts for BNB and Hyperliquid (HYPE), the first step toward potential spot ETFs in the U.S.
With $35B under management, the firm is moving beyond $BTC and ETH.

Why it matters:
* BNB represents a mature Layer-1 ecosystem
* HYPE is a young, infrastructure-stage asset
* Competition with VanEck signals rising institutional appetite

The key question:
Is this diversification a sign of ETF maturityâ€”or a test of regulatory limits?

$HYPE   (Hyperliquid) is down ~5% in the last 24h ğŸ“‰ and honestlyâ€¦ this move isnâ€™t that surprising.  A big part of it feels like unlock nerves. The monthly team unlock cadence is now â€œreal,â€ and even if the actual sell pressure is smaller than people fear, traders donâ€™t wait around â€” theyâ€™ll front-run the idea of supply hitting the market ğŸ§Š  Also, buybacks are greatâ€¦ but right now theyâ€™re not the headline ğŸª™ The vibe has shifted to: â€œok cool, but is revenue staying strong?â€ + â€œhow much supply is coming?â€ So buybacks have started to feel more like background support than a price engine.  Technically, HYPE also had that classic failed push higher. It tried to reclaim the ~$30-ish area recently, got swatted down, and once momentum fades you usually see quick sellers + stop runs kick in ğŸ“‰  And because HYPE is super trader-heavy, when perps cool off (OI drops / longs get cleaned out), it can slide faster than people expect âš¡  What Iâ€™m watching from here ğŸ‘€ â€¢ Does it hold ~$24 and chill (good sign), or lose it and turn that level into resistance (pain)? â€¢ Can it get back into the mid-$20s and start printing higher lows again? â€¢ Next unlock date â€” do we finally get a â€œsell the rumor, buy the newsâ€ moment for once? ğŸ˜­  Bottom line: this looks more like supply + positioning pressure than â€œsomething is broken.â€ But near-term, the chart still needs to stop bleeding before any bigger narrative stuff (institutional chatter, etc.) really matters. ğŸ§ ğŸ“Š
